Tanzania's Samia Suluhu Hassan, a president elected in bloodshed
subhead: Between 800 and 2,000 people were killed over three days during the crackdown surrounding the presidential election, which the incumbent head of state officially won with nearly 98% of the vote. The United Nations has called for a 'thorough and impartial investigation.'

France moves to suspend Shein website as first store opens in Paris
subhead: Faced with the French government's move to suspend the Shein website, the fast-fashion retailer said that it was suspending products from third-party sellers in France, after it was found to be selling childlike sex dolls.

title: Anesthetist accused of poisoning patients continues to deny charges at trial
subhead: Frédéric Péchier stands accused of poisoning 30 people, 12 of whom died. He has admitted that poisonings occurred, while firmly rebuffing prosecutors' attempts to incriminate him.

title: Emmanuel Carrère wins Prix Médicis for 'Kolkhoze'
subhead: Carrère's latest book is about his mother, Hélène Carrère d'Encausse (1929-2023), a Russian historian and perpetual secretary of the Académie Française, with whom relations were never easy.

title: Secluded Kalash tribe fights for survival in Pakistan
subhead: This ethnic and religious minority now numbers just 4,000 members and faces intrusive tourism and the degradation of their environment, which is essential to their survival.

'There's almost no water left': On the front lines of climate change in southern France
subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (6/6). Persistent drought, record temperatures, wildfires: Faced with the most acute effects of global warming, residents of the Aude department in southern France are looking for ways to keep their region alive.

title: Laurent Mauvignier wins 2025 Prix Goncourt for 'La Maison vide'
subhead: The writer won France's most prestigious literary prize for his monumental novel, a reinvention of his family's history across four generations, set in a rural French house.

title: For France's prime minister, a budget 'endurance race'
subhead: One week after the budget bill review began, Sébastien Lecornu's office fears the possibility that France may not have a budget by December 31.
